item.title: Co-Code is Bad Code
item.description: Learn why co-coding isn’t all it is cracked up to be. I’m sure you’ve all heard that your whole team should take ownership of the code base, and that pair programming really speeds up clean development, but let me lay something down. Very often this results in what they call “too many cooks in the kitchen”. Usually this will lead to unending arguments about implementation, and your “partner” isn’t willing to see the logic in your argument.
